name: Ratatouille
description: A classic French vegetable dish that's both healthy and delicious. Perfect combination of fresh vegetables slowly cooked to perfection.
instructions: Cut the vegetables into thin slices without the seeds
Cover the bottom of a baking dish with the tomato sauce
Assemble everything by alternating the vegetables
Crush the garlic and spread it on top, adding salt and rosemary to taste
Drizzle with a little olive oil and cover with parchment paper or aluminum foil
Bake in the oven for 40 minutes at a temperature of 180° C to 200° C (350° F to 400° F)

name: Simple Crepioca
description: A delicious Brazilian fusion of crepe and tapioca. Quick, easy, and incredibly versatile with sweet or savory fillings.
instructions: In a bowl, place the tapioca starch and the egg.
With a fork, beat vigorously until the mixture is homogeneous and the tapioca granules have completely dissolved, looking like just a beaten egg.
Heat a small frying pan over low heat and grease with a drizzle of coconut oil or olive oil, just enough to prevent sticking.
Pour the mixture into the pan and cook for a few minutes. The edges will start to lift on their own.
Carefully flip and cook for another minute on the other side.
Transfer to a plate and serve.
Be creative with fillings: cheese, shredded chicken, banana with cinnamon

name: Traditional Chicken Coxinha
description: The most beloved Brazilian snack! Crispy golden coxinhas filled with seasoned shredded chicken. Perfect for parties or afternoon treats.
instructions: Cook the chicken breast in water with salt, reserve the water and shred the chicken
In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic and onion, add annatto powder, oregano, tomato sauce, and shredded chicken
In a large pot, boil 1.5L of chicken cooking water with bouillon, seasoning, salt, and oil
Add all flour at once when boiling, stir vigorously for 10 minutes until dough pulls away from pan
Knead the hot dough until smooth and elastic, let cool
Shape portions of dough with chicken filling into coxinha form
Dip in water-salt-flour mixture, then coat with breadcrumbs
Fry in hot oil until golden brown

name: Grilled Chicken with Vegetables
instructions: Cut chicken fillets into thin slices and wash with lime juice
Mix Arisco seasoning, Sazón, and black pepper, season each chicken slice
Cut carrots and potatoes into rounds, green beans into three parts
Steam each vegetable separately until tender but firm
Season vegetables with salt and chopped cilantro
Heat olive oil and margarine in non-stick pan, grill chicken until golden
Serve chicken with steamed vegetables, drizzle vegetables with olive oil

name: Dried Beef Escondidinho (Traditional Version)
instructions: Desalt the dried beef for 12 hours, changing water several times
Pressure cook the desalted beef until tender, then shred
Cook cassava until tender, mash with milk and butter
Sauté onion and garlic, add shredded beef and seasonings
Layer cassava puree, beef filling, and more puree in baking dish
Top with cheese and bake until golden
The desalting process is crucial for the final flavor
This dish can be assembled in advance and baked just before serving

name: Dried Beef Escondidinho (Creamy Version)
instructions: Pressure cook the dried beef for 1h30, shred, and sauté with seasonings. Add 2 tbsp of requeijão at the end
Cook the cassava for 15 min. Mash with a fork
In a pan, sauté the mashed cassava with butter, onion, and garlic
Add the rest of the requeijão to the puree and mix well
Assemble in a baking dish with a layer of puree, the filling, and another layer of puree
Cover with grated cheese and bake to gratinate

name: Arracacha Soup with Dried Beef
instructions: Cook arracacha in boiling salted water until tender
Drain and blend with milk and bouillon cube until smooth
Sauté onion in butter, add dried beef and cook for 3 minutes
Add arracacha cream and cook until boiling
Stir in table cream, season with salt and pepper, turn off heat before boiling again
Serve hot with Parmesan and chives
For a special presentation, serve the soup inside a hollowed-out round Italian bread loaf
Do not let the soup boil after adding the cream to prevent curdling

name: Condensed Milk Pudding
instructions: Melt sugar over low heat until golden caramel forms
Carefully add water to caramel and stir until smooth
Pour caramel into pudding mold, covering bottom and sides
In blender, beat eggs for 1 minute, add condensed milk and milk, blend until smooth
Pour mixture into caramelized mold
Cover with aluminum foil and bake in water bath at 180°C for 45 minutes
Test doneness with toothpick - should come out clean
Cool completely and refrigerate before unmolding

name: Cheese Bread with Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F)
Heat water and oil until boiling
Pour boiling mixture over cassava starch and stir vigorously
Add Parmesan cheese and mix well
Add egg and mix until smooth, adjust salt
Shape into small balls with oiled hands
Bake until golden brown
The intense flavor of Parmesan makes this cheese bread an excellent pairing for wine and cocktails
Adjust the salt carefully, as Parmesan is already quite salty

name: Traditional Cheese Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). This step is crucial for the success of the recipe.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk and butter until it boils.

Pour the boiling mixture over the cassava starch and stir vigorously with a spoon to form a uniform paste. This process, known as 'scalding the starch', is the secret to the characteristic elastic texture.
Add the grated cheese and mix well to incorporate it into the dough. Then, add the egg and mix again. Adjust the salt if necessary, remembering that the cheese is already salty.
With oiled hands, shape small balls
Arrange the cheese breads on a baking sheet (no need to grease) and bake in the preheated medium oven until they are well-browned.

Tip: For a flawless result, don't be afraid to bake the cheese breads until they are golden—the ideal color is more bronze than yellow. The perfect texture depends on balance: if the dough is too sticky, it may have too much liquid; if it's dry, it may lack fat. Feel the dough and adjust if necessary.
